content:
graph LR
    classDef requirement fill:#f9f,stroke:#333,stroke-width:4px;
    classDef entity fill:#ff69b4,stroke:#333,stroke-width:4px;

    Phone Swap Request Feature[requirement]
    --> Background[entity]
    --> Feature Overview[entity]
    --> Implementation Details[entity]

    Background
    --> Users Lack Formal Way to Request Phone Exchange[entity]
    --> New Feature Aims to Create Streamlined Workflow[entity]

    Feature Overview
    --> User Story: "As a user, I want to request a phone from the available list and offer one of my current phones in exchange..."[entity]

    Implementation Details
    Frontend(UI/UX)[requirement]
    --> New Button: "Request Phone Swap"[entity]
    --> Modal Pop-up with Form[entity]
        --> Phone to Request: Dropdown List[entity]
        --> Phone to Exchange: Dropdown List[entity]
        --> Reason for Request (Optional): Text Area[entity]
        --> Actions: "Submit Request" and "Cancel" Buttons[entity]

    Backend(Logic)[requirement]
    --> New API Endpoint: POST /api/phone-swaps[entity]
    --> New Table in Database to Store Swap Requests[entity]
        --> Columns: Requester's ID, Requested Phone, Offered Phone, Status (defaulting to 'Pending'), and Comment[entity]

    Backend Validation
    --> Ensure User Making Request is Actual Owner of Phone Being Offered in Exchange[entity]

    Action Items
    UX Team: Create Wireframe of Modal and Form by EOD, October 17[requirement]
    Backend Team: Develop New API Endpoint and Database Schema. Target Completion: October 21[requirement]
    Frontend Team: Build "Request Phone Swap" Button and Basic Modal Structure. Begin Implementation Once Wireframes are Approved[requirement]
    Product Manager: Create Formal Jira Ticket with Defined User Story and Acceptance Criteria[requirement]

    Project Context
    --> Universal Project Context: Knows Entire Project By Heart[entity]
    --> Key Entities: 24[entity]
    --> Most Important Entities in Your Project:
        --> UserDto (class)[entity]
        --> WeatherForecast (class)[entity]
        --> UsersController (class)[entity]
        --> WeatherForecastController (class)[entity]
        --> IUserService (class)[entity]
        --> UserService (class)[entity]
        --> IMongoDBSettings (class)[entity]
        --> MongoDBSettings (class)[entity]
        --> AppRoutingModule (class)[entity]
        --> AppComponent (class)[entity]

    Retrieved Context
    --> Meeting Notes and Requirements[requirement]
    --> Codebase Context[requirement]

metadata.meeting_notes:
Phone Swap Request Feature
Date: October 14, 2025
Attendees: Product Manager, UX Designer, Lead Frontend Developer, Lead Backend Developer
Objective: Define the requirements and implementation plan fo

attempts.content:
Here is a Mermaid MindMap based on the provided context:

```mermaid
graph LR
    classDef requirement fill:#f9f,stroke:#333,stroke-width:4px;
    classDef entity fill:#ff69b4,stroke:#333,stroke-width:4px;

    Phone Swap Request Feature[requirement]
    --> Background[entity]
    --> Feature Overview[entity]
    --> Implementation Details[entity]

    Background
    --> Users Lack Formal Way to Request Phone Exchange[entity]
    --> New Feature Aims to Create Streamlined Workflow[entity]

    Feature Overview
    --> User Story: "As a user, I want to request a phone from the available list and offer one of my current phones in exchange..."[entity]

    Implementation Details
    Frontend(UI/UX)[requirement]
    --> New Button: "Request Phone Swap"[entity]
    --> Modal Pop-up with Form[entity]
        --> Phone to Request: Dropdown List[entity]
        --> Phone to Exchange: Dropdown List[entity]
        --> Reason for Request (Optional): Text Area[entity]
        --> Actions: "Submit Request" and "Cancel" Buttons[entity]

    Backend(Logic)[requirement]
    --> New API Endpoint: POST /api/phone-swaps[entity]
    --> New Table in Database to Store Swap Requests[entity]
        --> Columns: Requester's ID, Requested Phone, Offered Phone, Status (defaulting to 'Pending'), and Comment[entity]

    Backend Validation
    --> Ensure User Making Request is Actual Owner of Phone Being Offered in Exchange[entity]

    Action Items
    UX Team: Create Wireframe of Modal and Form by EOD, October 17[requirement]
    Backend Team: Develop New API Endpoint and Database Schema. Target Completion: October 21[requirement]
    Frontend Team: Build "Request Phone Swap" Button and Basic Modal Structure. Begin Implementation Once Wireframes are Approved[requirement]
    Product Manager: Create Formal Jira Ticket with Defined User Story and Acceptance Criteria[requirement]

    Project Context
    --> Universal Project Context: Knows Entire Project By Heart[entity]
    --> Key Entities: 24[entity]
    --> Most Important Entities in Your Project:
        --> UserDto (class)[entity]
        --> WeatherForecast (class)[entity]
        --> UsersController (class)[entity]
        --> WeatherForecastController (class)[entity]
        --> IUserService (class)[entity]
        --> UserService (class)[entity]
        --> IMongoDBSettings (class)[entity]
        --> MongoDBSettings (class)[entity]
        --> AppRoutingModule (class)[entity]
        --> AppComponent (class)[entity]

    Retrieved Context
    --> Meeting Notes and Requirements[requirement]
    --> Codebase Context[requirement]
```

This Mermaid MindMap provides a hierarchical structure to visualize the requirements, entities, and implementation details of the Phone Swap Request Feature. It includes all necessary details from the meeting notes and context, making it specific to this project.
